title: Enable ability to specify container image for OpenWebUI
body:
### Related to an existing integration?

Yes

### Existing integration

Ollama

### Overview

In the Ollama integration there is an additional builder enabling the OpenWebUI container image. Right now it is bound to a specific integrations' image tag.  The space is moving fast and Ollama and OpenWebUI are moving along fast with it. While the Ollama container image is flexible the OpenWebUI one is not.

It would be great to add a flexibility to provide the image tag as an override.

### Usage example

current:

```csharp
var ollama = builder.AddOllama("ollama")
    .WithDataVolume()
    .WithOpenWebUI(); //gets whatever image is in the resource now eg 0.4.8
```

proposed would enable:
```csharp
var ollama = builder.AddOllama("ollama")
    .WithDataVolume()
    .WithOpenWebUI(imageTag: "0.5.7");
```

### Breaking change?

No

### Alternatives

manually use AddContainer and re-specify all the defaults for the container, and establish connection with the Ollama resource.

### Additional context

No, just wanted to propose this

title: [Feature] Allow setting DacDeployOptions in DacpacDeployer when publishing SqlServer porjects from dacpac
body:
**Background**
I'm working in a project where we have a base dacpac with common schema elements for multiple instances of different databases building on top of the common schema elements. The dacpac is referenced as a PackageReference in the SqlServer project and normally published with the `IncludeCompositeObjects=true` option to deploy alle schema elements required.

As we attempt to adopt .Net Aspire, we are not easily able to do this without re-implementing the functionality of the `CommunityToolkit.Aspire.Hosting.SqlDatabaseProjects` package only to override the use of `new DacDeployOptions()` in `DacPacDeployer.Deploy()`.

It seems like a very usable feature to allow modifying the many `DacDeployOptions` properties passed to the Deploy operation for the dacpac in question.

**Proposal**
I thus propose an overload of the WithDacpac extension method for `SqlProjectResource `resource builders to set a new `DacDeployOptionsMetaDataAnnotation `which can be picked up when deploying the dacpac in the `SqlProjectPublishService` class.

Alternatively, the `DacDeployOptions` can be created and populated with supported property values from the sqlproj file in a new `GetDacDeployOptions` method in the `SqlProjectResource` class similar to how the `SqlTargetPath` and `TargetPath` are attempted read in the `GetDacpacPath` method.

**Help us help you**
Yes, I'd like to be assigned to work on this item, but am new to contributing on github.

title: Allow specifying selected model when calling WithReference with a Ollama resource
body:
### Related to an existing integration?

Yes

### Existing integration

Aspire.CommunityToolkit.Hosting.Ollama

### Overview

Allow specifying selected model when using WithReference with a Ollama resource.
Currently the selected model can only be easily set by using WithDefaultModel, but that locks to only one model and can't reference different ones in different resources easily. This can easily be solved by having an optional parameter on the custom WithReference for Ollama which allows specifying a selected model. If this optional parameter is not set, it will behave exactly the same as before: It would use the one specivied with WithDefaultModel on the Ollama resource.

```diff
+ public static IResourceBuilder<T> WithReference<T>(this IResourceBuilder<T> builder, IResourceBuilder<OllamaResource> ollama, string? selectedModel = null ) where T : IResourceWithEnvironment
- public static IResourceBuilder<T> WithReference<T>(this IResourceBuilder<T> builder, IResourceBuilder<OllamaResource> ollama) where T : IResourceWithEnvironment
```

### Usage example

```csharp
var ollama = builder.AddOllama("ollama", port: null)
    .AddModel("phi")
    .AddModel("phi3")
    .WithDefaultModel("phi")
    .WithOpenWebUI();

builder.AddProject<Projects.Aspire_CommunityToolkit_Hosting_Ollama_Web>("webfrontend")
    .WithExternalHttpEndpoints()
    .WithReference(ollama, /* adding this */ "phi3");
``` 

### Breaking change?

No

there is no release yet (also this only adds an optional parameter to an existing method)

### Alternatives

Setting the environment variable (Aspire__OllamaSharp__{resource.Name}__SelectedModel) manually, but that is not easily discoverable without looking at this source code. Maybe the way currently in the playground was added with the intention to do this, but it does not work:
```csharp
builder.AddProject<Projects.Aspire_CommunityToolkit_Hosting_Ollama_Web>("webfrontend")
    .WithExternalHttpEndpoints()
    .WithReference(ollama)
    .WithEnvironment("ollama:model", "phi3");
```

From an API design the `WithReference` requiring a second argument doesn't really align with Aspire, what would be more aligned with the design would be for the `AddModel` to return an `OllamaModelResource` so you could write something like this:

```csharp
var ollama = builder.AddOllama("ollama");

var phi3 = ollama.AddModel("phi3"); // model name is inferred from resource name
```
